page.title: 08ALL SAINTS CHURCH HURSLEY
page.content: The Church of All Saints is an attractive building with a traditional old spire.It stands in the church_yard which is full of,in spring,snowdrops, crocuses and daffodils. {The Reverend John Keble}who lived in the 19th century and was one of Hursley's most famous occupants,being a good poet,is buried inn the Churchyard. The present church is the third on the site,following 12th century and 18th century buildings dating from 1884.The{tower}is original and considering its age it is a very well preserved building.The interior is spacious,airy and dignified,and has magic and romance which is partly why the Church of All Saints appeals to so many people.
